references.reason: This book is a foundational text in causal inference, providing the theoretical basis for much of the work in this paper.
This book expands on Pearl's earlier work, further developing the theory of causal inference and its applications.
This book is a standard reference in information theory, providing the mathematical framework for many of the concepts used in this paper.

This paper introduces important concepts and algorithms for identifying conditional independence in Bayesian networks, which are relevant to the qualitative aspects of probability distributions discussed in this paper.

This paper introduces the concept of probabilistic dependency graphs, which are directly relevant to the hypergraphs used in this paper to represent qualitative structures in probability distributions.
